      #parse("oetinvest/header.vm")

<h1>Test Race: Introduction</h1>

<table><tr><td bgcolor='$!data.voicecolor'><i>The next part of the experiment 
will involve making some decisions with regard to a car race,
which will work as follows. 
All five cars in the race are identical, and you will bet some of 
the money you've earned on one of them winning the race.  A complete race lasts for 10 laps, and there will be six races in total.
<br>
<br>
Let me emphasise that at the start of the race, the cars are identical in every aspect relevant to winning.  Depending on how much is
invested in its engine, each car is prone to a rate of engine stalls.  An engine stall causes the car to drop in speed for a short 
period of time.  At the start of the race, if the stalling rates are identical, then each car has just 
as much chance of winning the race as every other car.  
<br>
<br>
You'll first be allowed to choose what colour you want for your car, plus how much money you want to bet on it and 
how much you want to invest into the engine to lower the engine stall rate.  
All of the cars competing against yours will stall, on average, 2 times every 5 laps.
The amount you invest in your car's engine will determine its rate of stalls.
To help you make your decisions, you'll be given some information about the 
payout if your car wins, and what happens if you choose to withdraw from the bet during the race.  
You will also be asked to guess how likely your car is to win the race, and how confident you 
are about your guess.  Then, the race will begin.  If you click 'Continue', you will 
be taken through the first test race.  (Note that your actual choices in this test race will have no effect on anything:  this is just a `dry run'.) </i></td></tr></table>

<p><mp3 name='testrace_intro' file='oetinvest/media/tr02_intro.mp3' button='Continue'></p>

#parse("oetinvest/footer.vm")
